page.title: 07MONT ORGUEIL CASTLE (6)
page.content:
The first tableau has a lovely granite fireplace, and the scene tells of July 1373, when{Bertrand du {Guesclin, Constable of France, {gathered together}2,000 men-at-arms and 600 archers to attack Mont Orgueil, which managed to hold out until help arrived from the English fleet.
The next scene shows{Sir Antony {Paulet}and his son looking at plans for the remodelling of the castle in the reign of Elizabeth 1. By the end of her reign, however, it had been decided to build a new castle, later called{Elizabeth Castle.}The 'Old Castle' was to be demolished to provide some of the materials needed, but it was saved by{Sir Walter Ralegh, who was{Governor of Jersey 1600-1603.
